result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:23 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane. 
Defendant Theodis D Thomas not in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Theodis D Thomas. 
Atty Kershek states his client is currently in Cook County Jail. 
Atty Kershek requests a new date.
Hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

02:34 PM Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Defendant Theodis D Thomas. Attorney  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Theodis D Thomas not in court.

Atty Kershek states that his client is in custody pending an extradition from Cook County Jail and requests another date. Court sets. 
  Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Check Case scheduled for June 24, 2022.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: 10:51 AM Defendant Theodis D Thomas in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  City of Brookfield Police Department Detective Salvatore Alioto sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Zilavy.  Cross examination by Attorney Kershek.  State rests.  State moves for bind over with argument.  Attorney Kershek objects to bind over with argument.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen.

Status conference on May 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 4, 2022 at 10:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Theodis D Thomas
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 04-27-2022)
Prior: 1916 Vermont St #2, Blue Island, IL 50406

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to have no contact with victims/witnesses/co-defendant (Precious A Reed) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to have no contact with any Kesslers Diamond Centers.

01:29 PM Defendant Theodis D Thomas in court, in custody, with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
